title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી પરચા વર્ણવી, કહું અલૌકિક એહ<RHYME_207053>; 
સાંભળજ્યો સહુ શ્રવણે, કરી અધિક સનેહ<RHYME_207053>.
gujarati.context: The speaker's words are as colorful as the rainbow, and they say something extraordinary; listen carefully to my words of affection, which exceed ordinary love.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મોટા સંત મહારાજના, છે શિરોમણી સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>; 
ફરે એકલા ઉત્તરે, જેને નહિ જન મન ત્રાસ<RHYME_207054>.
gujarati.context: The great saint Maharaaj has a devotee called Santadas; He alone goes to the north, where no one's heart trembles with fear.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માની વચન મહારાજનું, ધાર્યું અંતરે અનુપ<RHYME_207055>; 
તેદિના તન ભાન ભૂલી, થયા તેહ તદરૂપ<RHYME_207055>.
gujarati.context: The divine words of the great king were absorbed within; it was as if my soul had forgotten itself that day.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેની વારતા સાંભળો, લખું છું લવલેશ<RHYME_207056>; 
જે દેહ છતે સિદ્ધદશા પામી, ફરે છે ઉત્તર દેશ<RHYME_207056>.
gujarati.context: Listen to her story, I will write with passion; She has achieved spiritual fulfillment despite the constraints of the physical body and is roaming freely in search of higher truths.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધન્ય ધન્ય સાધુ સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>, જેને નહિ આ તન અધ્યાસ<RHYME_207054>; 
પિંડ છતાં પામી સિદ્ધ ગતિ, ફરે લોક પરલોકે સુમતિ.
gujarati.context: The grateful saint, Dhanyadhanya, who has not been bound by worldly desires; the childlike soul, having achieved its goal, now enjoys eternal bliss in the afterlife.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને કૃપા કરી કહે કૃપાળુ, દેખી આવો દલુજી દયાળુ; 
તિયાં જાવુંતું અવશ્ય અમારે, સરશે અર્થ તે ગયે તમારે.
gujarati.context: Have mercy on him and have pity, show him kindness; our time will come when we go, but your fate is already decided.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહેજ્યો આંહિની સરવે વાત<RHYME_207060>, સુણી દલુ થાશે રળિયાત<RHYME_207060>; 
બીજા મુક્ત તિયાં ષટ્દશ<RHYME_207061>, એક બાઈ સુંદર સુજશ<RHYME_207061>.
gujarati.context:
The summary is:

One should be mindful of the present moment and not get caught up in idle chatter, as it will lead to nothing but regret later on; instead, take pride in being a beautiful and elegant person like the lotus flower that blooms freely.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને કહેજ્યો આશિર વચન<RHYME_207062>, જાઓ વેગેશું વેલેરા જન<RHYME_207062>; 
સુણી વચન ચાલ્યા સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>, દૂરદેશમાં દલુજી પાસ<RHYME_207054>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Go forth with haste, and may your journey be successful; may your path be lit by the words of the saints, guiding you through distant lands.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ અગમ વિકટ વાટ<RHYME_207063>, ઘણું નદીના ઓઘટ ઘાટ<RHYME_207063>; 
નરતને તિયાં ન જવાય<RHYME_207064>, વાટે મનુષ્ય મનુષ્યને ખાય<RHYME_207064>.
gujarati.context: A very great and mighty wave crashes down, like many falls of the river's edge; The waves devour man after man, not leaving any.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં ચાલ્યા સંતદાસ જન<RHYME_207062>, માની મહાપ્રભુનું વચન<RHYME_207062>; 
કરી ઇચ્છા ને મીંચી છે આંખ્યો, ઊડ્યું પંડ આવી જાણે પાંખો.
gujarati.context: The devotee's heart is filled with the Lord's word, and their desires are humbled; their gaze is directed towards flying high like a bird.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પળ એક માંહિ તિયાં પહોતા, દીઠા દલુજીને મુક્તે સોતા; 
ઉઠી આવ્યા સામા સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>, હેતે મળીને બેસાર્યા પાસ<RHYME_207054>.
gujarati.context: In the morning, worries are washed away like clouds; and in the evening, one finds peace after a day's hard work.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કરી પૂજા મળી વળી જન<RHYME_207062>, પછી ભાવે કરાવ્યાં ભોજન<RHYME_207062>; 
બેઠા સંતદાસ પાસ દલુ, પૂછ્યું પ્રશ્ન ભાવેભરી ભલું.
gujarati.context: After worshipping and taking food, we should be satisfied with our earnings; after sitting comfortably, ask questions to understand the truth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહો સંતદાસ સાચી વાત<RHYME_207060>, સ્વામી સહજાનંદની વિખ્યાત<RHYME_207060>; 
બોલ્યા સંતદાસ શું હું કહું, આજ વાવરે સામર્થિ બહુ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The saintly words are true and famous, as they are said with simple joy; I will speak today, having obtained the strength to do so.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પાપી પામર જીવ જે જગે, તાર્યા કોટિ તે દીઠા મેં દ્રગે; 
દ્વિજ ક્ષત્રી વૈશ્ય શૂદ્ર કોઈ<RHYME_207068>, થાય સમાધિ સ્વામીને જોઈ<RHYME_207068>.
gujarati.context: A sinner will be punished in the afterlife for their actions, just like a thousand crores are weighed on a scale; regardless of one's caste or social status, they will face judgment by the supreme being.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હોય કોઈ નર વળી નાર્ય<RHYME_207069>, વરતે પિંડ બ્રહ્માંડને પાર્ય<RHYME_207069>; 
બહુ શાસ્ત્રે સાંભળી મેં વાત<RHYME_207060>, પણ આજની વાત અખ્યાત<RHYME_207060>.
gujarati.context: There is no one who has not been deceived by someone, just as the universe is traversed by a child's tiny step;
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે દલુજી કહે સુણો સંત<RHYME_207070>, આજ આવ્યા પોતે ભગવંત<RHYME_207070>; 
બીજા થાય કોટિ અવતાર<RHYME_207071>, તેનું કારણ છે નિરધાર<RHYME_207071>.
gujarati.context: The soul says to the saint that it was impure earlier but has now arrived at God's doorstep, seeking liberation. This cycle of rebirth is due to a predetermined cause and not by chance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવી કરી પરસ્પર વાત<RHYME_207060>, સુણી સહુ થયા રળિયાત<RHYME_207060>; 
એમ વાત કરતાં હુલાસે, રહ્યા છ માસ દલુજી પાસે.
gujarati.context: After sharing words with each other, they became good friends and are now celebrating together after five months of separation; their joy is palpable as they reunite.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી દલુજી કહે સુણો જન<RHYME_207062>, જાઓ તિયાં કરો દરશન<RHYME_207062>; 
જે છે તે ત્યાં જ છે તમે જાણો, એથી અધિક નહિ પ્રમાણો.
gujarati.context: As you wander, remember that what is meant to be will be, and don't worry about measuring its value. Just know that what is destined for you will come to pass at the right time.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંતદાસે શીખ માગી, ચાલ્યા વેગે વળી બડભાગી; 
આવ્યા સ્વામી સહજાનંદ પાસે, કર્યાં દરશન સંતદાસે.
gujarati.context: After seeking the guru's permission, Santdas ran quickly and reached his master Swamiji with joy; then, he did darshan (met) with Santdas.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી કરી દલુજીની વાત<RHYME_207060>, સાંભળી મહારાજે સાક્ષાત<RHYME_207060>; 
દલુજી તે મુક્ત અવતાર<RHYME_207071>, એક બાઈ પણ નિરધાર<RHYME_207071>.
gujarati.context: After having done the injustice of Dalujini's story, Maharaja listened intently; Dalujini is a free avatar, even a daughter can't predict its outcome.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
દિવ્યમૂર્તિ એ જાણજ્યો દોય<RHYME_207075>, અન્યજનને ભેટ્ય ન હોય<RHYME_207075>; 
તેનાં દર્શન કર્યાં સંતદાસે, રહી પોત્યે ષટ્ માસ પાસે.
gujarati.context: The divine being is known only to oneself and not to others; the saintly person has seen this vision, and it remains with them for seven months.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એ તો પરચો કહ્યો મેં એક<RHYME_207076>, એવા બીજા થયા છે અનેક<RHYME_207076>; 
પછી રહ્યા તિયાં કાંઈ દન<RHYME_207077>, વળતા એમ બોલ્યા ભગવન<RHYME_207077>.
gujarati.context: I have taken one path alone, while many others followed; and after that, I found nothing at all, so God spoke to me in this manner.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સંતદાસને કહ્યું સાનમાં, જાઓ તમે બદરિવનમાં; 
નરનારાયણ ઋષિરાય<RHYME_207079>, જે રહ્યા છે બદ્રિવન માંય<RHYME_207079>.
gujarati.context: To the seeker of spiritual truth, it is said: "Go to Badrinath, where God resides." The phrase suggests that one should strive for divine connection.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એકરૂપ અમારું છે એહ<RHYME_207053>, બીજું પ્રકટ દેખો છો તેહ<RHYME_207053>; 
બહુરૂપે બહુધામે રહું છું, ત્યાંના વાસીને સુખ દઉં છું.
gujarati.context: We are one in essence, but appear differently to others; I have many forms and experiences, but bring joy to those who live with me.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પણ બદ્રિકાશ્રમના વાસી, અતિ ત્યાગ વૈરાગ્યે તપસી; 
માટે એ છે વહલા મને અતિ, તેને જોઈ આવો મહામતિ.
gujarati.context: The ascetic living in Badrinath is renounced and pure through his intense spiritual practice, resulting in an extraordinary understanding of the supreme being. He sees God in all beings, having transcended worldly attachments and desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ચાલ્યા ત્યાંથી સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>, નરનારાયણ ઋષિ પાસ<RHYME_207054>; 
એ તો વાત છે આશ્ચર્યકારી, જોજ્યો સહુ અંતરે વિચારી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

One should seek guidance from the wise and knowledgeable, such as Santdas and Narayan Rishi. This is an astonishing matter that requires careful thought and introspection.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આ દેહે જે જાવું ઉત્તરદેશ<RHYME_207084>, હિમાદ્રિ પર કરી પ્રવેશ<RHYME_207084>; 
તે તો આ શરીરે ન જવાય<RHYME_207064>, જાય તે તો ઈશ્વર કહેવાય<RHYME_207064>.
gujarati.context: This couplet says that the soul leaves this body and enters the north, reaching the snowy mountains of the afterlife; it is not the physical body that goes, but rather it is said to be God's call.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવી સામર્થિ જે થકી આવે, તે તો સર્વનું કારણ કાવે; 
તેની આજ્ઞા લઈ સંતદાસે, ચાલ્યા ઉત્તર ખંડે હુલાસે.
gujarati.context: When fate arises, it becomes the reason for all; Santdas follows its command and goes to the Himalayas with eagerness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ વસમા વિકટ ઘાટ<RHYME_207063>, તનધારીને નહિ જાવા વાટ<RHYME_207063>; 
એવી વાટે ચાલ્યા વીતરાગી, ગયા હિમાળા પાર સુભાગી.
gujarati.context:
The summary is:

A strong and intense effort may seem futile at first, but it can lead to a successful crossing of life's difficulties; one such effort led me to cross the Himalayas with great ease.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવી ત્યાં પથરા નદી, તનધારી તરે નહિ કદિ; 
ધાતુ કાષ્ઠાદિક વસ્તુ કાંઈ, થાય પથર પડે પાણી માંઇ.
gujarati.context:
After a long time, the stones will be washed away in the river; nothing remains of what was once valuable.

The things that were once precious and treasured are swept away like stones into the water.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવે ગુણે જુક્ત જાણી નીર<RHYME_207087>, પગ ન બોળ્યો બેસિયા તીર<RHYME_207087>; 
કરતાં અંબુ ઊતરવા વિચાર<RHYME_207087>, એવે સમે આવ્યા ઋષિ ચ્યાર<RHYME_207087>.
gujarati.context: A person's virtue is known by their actions, not just words; even the great Rishi Chyara was tested in his thoughts before being accepted.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે કિયાં જાવું મુનિજન<RHYME_207062>, મુનિ કહે જાવું બદ્રિકાવન<RHYME_207088>; 
કહે ઋષિ ચાલો અમ સાથ<RHYME_207089>, મીંચો આંખ્યો ઊતરિયે પાથ<RHYME_207089>.
gujarati.context: The Munis (ascetics) and munis of Badrikaavana are moving together, their eyes cast down in humility. Let us follow them with reverence, as they walk the path of spirituality.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મીંચ્યાં લોચન ન કરી વાર<RHYME_207090>, આવ્યા દશ જોજન જળ પાર<RHYME_207090>; 
તિયાં દીઠું છે આશ્રમ સારું, બેઠા ઋષિ જ્યાં લાખ હજારું.
gujarati.context: Crossing the ocean of desire is not a war, it's a journey across ten worlds to reach the other shore; in this sacred ashram, the sages have sat for millions of years.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
શુભ બદ્રિ અદ્રિ એક સાર<RHYME_207092>, તિયાં ગુફા હજારેહજાર<RHYME_207092>; 
મધ્યે ગુફા દીઠી એક ઘેરી, તે તો નરનારાયણ કેરી.
gujarati.context: A good home is a shelter from the storms of life, with thousands of worries and troubles. In the midst of these troubles, there is only one cure: the love and protection of Lord Naranaya.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં પહોત્યા પોત્યે સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>, ઊઠી આપે મળ્યા અવિનાશ; 
બહુ હેતે કર્યું સનમાન<RHYME_207094>, ભલે આવ્યા કહે ભગવાન<RHYME_207094>.
gujarati.context: The couplet speaks of a person who has gained eternal life through devotion to God and has been blessed with eternal bliss, which is beyond human comprehension.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આપ્યાં ઋષિએ અમળ જળ<RHYME_207095>, પછી જમાડ્યાં સુંદર ફળ<RHYME_207095>; 
ત્યાર પછી પૂછ્યું ઋષિરાય<RHYME_207079>, કહો મહાપ્રભુનો મહિમાય<RHYME_207079>.
gujarati.context: The wise person cultivates the soul with pure water, and subsequently bears beautiful fruits. After that, they asked the sage, "What is the glory of the great lord?"
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે નરનારાયણ નાથ<RHYME_207089>, શું કરે છે હરિ ઋષિ સાથ<RHYME_207089>; 
કહે સંતદાસ શું હું કહું, આજ વાત અલેખે છે બહુ.
gujarati.context: The couplet asks what God (Narayan) does with the devotee's thoughts and prayers, wondering if He listens to their every word. The speaker, Santadas, says he will reveal more on this topic today.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વાવરે છે સામર્થિ જે શ્યામ<RHYME_207096>, કહેતાં મન વાણી પામે વિરામ<RHYME_207096>; 
તે તો જાણો છો સરવે નાથ<RHYME_207089>, પૂછ્યું માટે કહું જોડી હાથ<RHYME_207089>.
gujarati.context: One who is not wise and knowledgeable, even the foolishness of Shyam can be understood by them; that's why I'm explaining it to you for nothing, my friend.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ પૂછતાં શુભ સમાચાર<RHYME_207071>, કહ્યા સંતદાસે નિરધાર<RHYME_207071>; 
એમ કહેતાં સાંભળતાં વળી, થઈ સંધ્યા સુંદર નિરમળી.
gujarati.context: When good news is shared, it's as if fate has been sealed; and when spoken, it becomes even more beautiful at sunset, without a single imperfection.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બેઠા શુભાસને બેઉ વીર<RHYME_207098>, આવ્યા દર્શને મુનિ સુધીર<RHYME_207098>; 
નયણાં ભરીને નીરખ્યા નાથ<RHYME_207089>, પછી મળ્યા સંતદાસ સાથ<RHYME_207089>.
gujarati.context: Two friends, Veer and Sudhir, met a saint after years of seeking; their hearts were filled with joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સહુ બોલાવે હેત સમેત<RHYME_207099>, હૈયે ભાવ દેખાડે છે હેત<RHYME_207099>; 
કહે નારાયણ સુણો સંત<RHYME_207099>, આ તો ઋષિ છે ત્યાગી અત્યંત<RHYME_207099>.
gujarati.context: The speaker is summoned by the god Narayana, a saintly sage, who has renounced worldly attachments and is now departing from this mortal world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કોઈકને વીતે વર્ષ બાર<RHYME_207100>, ત્યારે એક દિન કરે આહાર<RHYME_207100>; 
કોઈકને વીતે ષટ્ વર્ષ<RHYME_207101>, ત્યારે લાગે છે ભૂખ ને તર્ષ<RHYME_207101>.
gujarati.context: One may live for 12 years without a day of joy, and then just one day of happiness becomes their sustenance; Similarly, someone may live for 80 years without feeling the pangs of hunger, but when they start to feel it, even a small portion becomes satisfying.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કોઈક જમે વરસે એક<RHYME_207076>, ષટ માસવાળા છે અનેક<RHYME_207076>; 
કોઈ કરે છે મહિનામાં આહાર<RHYME_207100>, પક્ષવાળા હજારોહજાર<RHYME_207100>.
gujarati.context: Many people spend one year and eight months waiting for something to happen; meanwhile, thousands are struggling to make ends meet.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે જન સમાધિયે સુખી, કોઈ રીત્યે ઋષિ નથી દુઃખી; 
સર્વેનાં છે તપમય તન<RHYME_207103>, અંતર વૃત્તિયે કરે ભજન<RHYME_207103>.
gujarati.context: The entire world finds happiness in renunciation, and no wise person is unhappy; within our own souls, we create rituals of devotion through self-control.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જ્યારે ઇચ્છે અન્ન જળ જેહ<RHYME_207053>, આપી જાય સિદ્ધિ સદ્ય તેહ<RHYME_207053>; 
એમ વાત કરી નરવીરે, સુણી સંતદાસજી સુધીરે.
gujarati.context: When one desires something sincerely and with a pure heart, their goals are achieved soon; this is the will of God, as said by Guru Santadasa.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં વીત્યા કાંઈ દિન<RHYME_207105>, કર્યું માનસરે જાવા મન<RHYME_207105>; 
ત્યારે સંતને કહે નરવીર<RHYME_207106>, ન્હાશો નીરે નહિ ખમે શરીર<RHYME_207106>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the couplet in English:

One day, you'll realize that what was done can't be undone; then come to your senses and don't waste your precious life.

(Note: I've tried to maintain the rhyme scheme and meter of the original couplet while conveying its essence.)
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે વણ નાહ્યે વહેલા વળજ્યો, મુનિ સહિત જોઈ મને મળજ્યો; 
પછી માનસરે ગયા જન<RHYME_207062>, દીઠાં હંસ કમળનાં વન<RHYME_207062>.
gujarati.context: As I awoke from my slumber, my worries disappeared with the morning sun; afterwards, I became like a gentle swan floating on lotus flowers of serenity.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જોઈ પાછા વળ્યા ઋષિરાય<RHYME_207079>, નાહ્યા સંતદાસજી તે માંય<RHYME_207079>; 
વ્યાપી શીત ને ઠર્યું શરીર<RHYME_207106>, લાવ્યા ઉપાડી જ્યાં નરવીર<RHYME_207106>.
gujarati.context: When the wise one's words are gone, and I am left behind; my body is worn out by winter's chill, but where there is no fear, that is where I reside.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બહુ તાપે તપાડ્યું તન<RHYME_207103>, ત્યારે સચેત થયા મુનિજન<RHYME_207062>; 
પછી લાગ્યા નારાયણ પાય<RHYME_207108>, રહ્યા માસ પક્ષ મુનિ ત્યાંય<RHYME_207108>.
gujarati.context: After being scolded and punished, the Munivari became aware of their mistakes; later, they took refuge in Lord Narayan's path.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નરવીર કહે સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>, તમે જાઓ મહા પ્રભુ પાસ<RHYME_207054>; 
જે છે તે તો સરવે છે તિયાં, શાને બેસી રહો સાધુ ઇયાં.
gujarati.context: The poor soul is telling Saint Das to depart and go to the Lord's feet, for whatever happens will happen by God's will.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી શીખ દીધી નાથ<RHYME_207089>, મોકલ્યા ઋષિ ચ્યારને સાથ<RHYME_207089>; 
તે ઉતારી ગયા નદી પાર<RHYME_207090>, વળ્યા પાછા કરી નમસ્કાર<RHYME_207090>.
gujarati.context: The wise Shikh learned that when the sage went away, he crossed the river and came back to pay his respects.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ચાલ્યા મુનિ હૈયામાં હુલાસે, આવ્યા સુંદર દેશ કૈલાસે; 
તેનો હઠયોગી રહે નરેશ<RHYME_207110>, આવી આપ્યો તેને ઉપદેશ<RHYME_207110>.
gujarati.context: A monk wandered, seeking spiritual growth, and found a beautiful land, gaining wisdom from his experiences. His self-realization allowed him to guide others through teachings.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
રાજા જાતો સમાધિમાં જ્યારે, રહેતો ષટમાસ સુધી ત્યારે;

gujarati.context: When the king is in meditation, he remains focused for a hundred years. Even then, his worries and troubles do not leave him.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને સંતદાસે સુખી કીધો, અન્ય ભાવ ઊગવા ન દીધો; 
કરાવ્યાં પ્રકટનાં દર્શન<RHYME_207103>, થઈ સુખી રાયે તજ્યું તન<RHYME_207103>.
gujarati.context: He was made to feel joy by his master, and no other worldly attachment could disturb that; he achieved the ultimate bliss through seeing the divine forms.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ફૂટી તાળુ ને નીસર્યા પ્રાણ<RHYME_207114>, ચાલ્યો સત્સંગ કરી સુજાણ<RHYME_207114>; 
ત્યાંથી સંતદાસજી સધાવ્યા, એક વેરવાલે ગામ આવ્યા.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the departure of life force from a dying person's body and their soul moving on to a spiritual realm, guided by saints. The journey is facilitated by a single thread, symbolizing the connection between the physical and spiritual worlds.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ઝાલ્યા તસ્કર કરીને તેણે, અતિ પ્રહાર કરી બાંધ્યા એણે; 
હેરુ જાણી દિયે દુઃખ બહુ, કરે મારવા મનસૂબો સહુ.
gujarati.context: The one who has been hurt in the past has taken great care to mend their broken heart; now they know that sorrow is a lot, and it's a debt they must pay.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેનાં સગાં વાલાં જન જેહ<RHYME_207053>, આવ્યા નાથ રૂપ ધરી તેહ<RHYME_207053>; 
મળી વળી મુકાવિયો જન<RHYME_207062>, ચાલ્યા દાસને દઇ દરશન<RHYME_207062>.
gujarati.context: A person's true nature is revealed in the company they keep; if they are with noble people, they will adopt their noble qualities.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાંથી સંતદાસજી સધાવ્યા, ઘણે દને ગુજરધર આવ્યા; 
જેતલપુર ડભાણ ગામ<RHYME_207118>, દિન દશ કર્યો વિશરામ<RHYME_207118>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Saint Dasji settled there, many good people came to Gujarat; like Jetpur village, a day's journey for rest and leisure.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ત્યાંથી આવ્યા પ્રભુ પાસ<RHYME_207054>, મળ્યા નાથ સંતે સંતદાસ<RHYME_207054>; 
સનમુખ બેસી સંતજને, કહ્યું જે જે પૂછ્યું ભગવને.
gujarati.context: After seeking God's guidance, Saint Das arrived at the conclusion that whatever He had asked for, He would receive.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કરી સુંદર વારતા સાને, સમજી સુણી નહિ કેણે કાને; 
કહ્યું અલૌકિક જે આખ્યાન<RHYME_207121>, સમજે સંત કહે શ્રીભગવાન<RHYME_207094>.
gujarati.context: The beautiful stories are misunderstood by those who don't have ears to listen; only the saints, guided by God, can truly understand this divine tale.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાથ કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય, તમ જેવો બીજો નહિ જન<RHYME_207062>; 
તમે પામ્યા છો સિદ્ધગતિ, માટે સહુથી મોટા તમે અતિ.
gujarati.context: You are blessed with great fortune, and none like you will be born again; you have achieved perfection, so you are truly immense among others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હવે ફરો સતસંગ માંઇ, કરો વાત તમે દીઠી ત્યાંઈ; 
એવા સમર્થ સંત વિખ્યાત<RHYME_207060>, પામ્યા જેથી તેની સઇ વાત<RHYME_207060>.
gujarati.context: Now go where there is good company and have a conversation about what you've learned; such knowledgeable saints are famous, which makes their words so valuable.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વાત મોટી છે મહારાજ તણી, કહી ન જાય મુખથી ઘણી; 
હરિ હરિજનનો મહિમાય<RHYME_207079>, કહે જથારથ ન કેવાય<RHYME_207079>.
gujarati.context:
A great truth is difficult to express, many things cannot be said with the mouth; 

The glory of God's devotees is beyond description.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 129: Shrījī Mahārāje Santdāsjīne Parachā Pūryā

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī parachā varṇavī, kahu alaukik eh; <RHYME_1>
Sāmbhaḷajyo sahu shravaṇe, karī adhik saneh.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of someone's words as extraordinary and divine. It highlights the joy and deep connection that comes from listening to them.

transliteration.couplet:
Moṭā sant Mahārājnā, chhe shiromaṇī Santdās; <RHYME_2>
Fare ekalā uttare, jene nahi jan man trās.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The great soul Mahārāj is like a fragrant flower, and his friend Santdās is also a noble one. One's worries cease when one meets someone who understands them.

transliteration.couplet:
Mānī vachan Mahārājnu, dhāryu antare anup; <RHYME_3>
Tedinā tan bhān bhūlī, thayā teh tadarūp.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The words of a great king are like a hidden treasure within one's heart, and its value cannot be measured by others. The true form of a person is revealed only to those who see through the veil of deception.

transliteration.couplet:
Tenī vāratā sāmbhaḷo, lakhu chhu lavalesh; <RHYME_4>
Je deh chhate siddhadashā pāmī, fare chhe uttar desh.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: In a nutshell, the couplet says that one should have a simple and humble life (Tenī vāratā) without worldly attachments, and if one has already lived such a life, they will achieve spiritual success (siddhadashā pāmī).

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya dhanya sādhu santadās, jene nahi ā tan adhyās; <RHYME_5>
Pinḍ chhatā pāmī siddha gati, fare lok paraloke sumati.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises a saintly person who has achieved spiritual growth and is free from worldly desires. This individual has reached the ultimate goal of enlightenment and enjoys supreme peace in this life and beyond.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene kṛupā karī kahe kṛupāḷu, dekhī āvo Dalujī dayāḷu; <RHYME_6>
Tiyā jāvutu avashya amāre, sarashe arth te gaye tamāre.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: Mercy is shown when mercy is asked for, and compassion is seen in others' eyes. Ultimately, one's own fate is certain to unfold, as the truth will soon reveal itself to you.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahejyo āhinī sarave vāt, suṇī Dalu thāshe raḷiyāt; <RHYME_7>
Bījā mukta tiyā ṣhaṭdash, ek bāī sundar Sujash.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The wind whispers secrets to all who listen, while the sweet melody of love echoes in one's heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene kahejyo āshir vachan, jāo vegeshu velerā jan; <RHYME_8>
Suṇī vachan chālyā Santdās, dūr-deshmā Dalujī pās.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about the teachings of a wise guru who guides his disciples to their destination, and with great love, one can reach far-off places like Dauliji in a distant land.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati agam vikaṭ vāṭ, ghaṇu nadīnā oghaṭ ghāṭ; <RHYME_9>
Nartane tiyā na javāy, vāṭe manuṣhya manuṣhyane khāy.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the turmoil of life as a treacherous river that sweeps away even the strong and wise. In this chaos, humanity is consumed by its own desires, unaware of the impending doom.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā chālyā Santdās jan, mānī mahā-Prabhunu vachan; <RHYME_10>
Karī ichchhā ne mīchī chhe ākhyo, ūḍyu panḍ āvī jāṇe pānkho.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The devotee Santdas follows the command of Lord Prabhu; his desire is fulfilled through devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Paḷ ek māhi tiyā pahotā, dīṭhā Dalujīne mukte sotā; <RHYME_11>
Uṭhī āvyā sāmā Santdās, hete maḷīne besāryā pās.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The ocean's waves have calmed down, and the sea serpent's secrets are revealed; The liberated soul has reached the shore, and its desires are fulfilled.

transliteration.couplet:
Karī pūjā maḷī vaḷī jan, pachhī bhāve karāvyā bhojan; <RHYME_12>
Beṭhā Santdās pās Dalu, pūchhyu prashna bhāvebharī bhalu.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: A meal is enjoyed after the worship is done, and then we ask for leftovers. At home, even the poorest person, Santdas, has a share of Dalu, and all questions are answered in a friendly manner.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaho Santdās sāchī vāt, Swāmī Sahajānandnī vikhyāt; <RHYME_13>
Bolyā Santdās shu hu kahu, āj vāvare sāmarthi bahu.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: The couplet is describing the saintliness of Santdas and Swami Sahajanandnī, with their words being truthful and famous. It also mentions that Santdas has spoken little but now possesses great power.

transliteration.couplet:
Pāpī pāmar jīv je jage, tāryā koṭi te dīṭhā me drage; <RHYME_14>
Dvij kṣhatrī vaishya shūdra koī, thāya samādhi Swāmīne joī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context:
All sinful souls that wake up, will suffer intensely in their next birth; 
Regardless of caste, whether Brahmin or not, all are equal in the Lord's presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Hoy koī nar vaḷī nārya, varate pinḍ brahmānḍne pārya; <RHYME_15>
Bahu shāstre sāmbhaḷī me vāt, paṇ ājnī vāt akhyāt.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: A person's true nature is revealed only when they are in trouble or facing a crisis, and one should not judge others based on appearances alone. The true character of someone can be understood through their actions in difficult situations.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Dalujī kahe suṇo sant, āj āvyā pote Bhagwant; <RHYME_16>
Bījā thāy koṭi avatār, tenu kāraṇ chhe niradhār.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: The couplet asks you to listen carefully and understand the divine message from Dalujī, where God is present in every step; the seeds of countless lives are planted within you, but your actions should be unattached.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī karī paraspar vāt, suṇī sahu thayā raḷiyāt; <RHYME_17>
Em vāt karatā hulāse, rahyā chha mās Dalujī pāse.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The monsoon winds blow between each other's spaces, filling the valleys with sweet sounds; The same wind makes the hills of Daluj resonate with joy for four months.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Dalujī kahe suṇo jan, jāo tiyā karo darashan; <RHYME_18>
Je chhe te tyā ja chhe tame jāṇo, ethī adhik nahi pramāṇo.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet advises to listen carefully to the words of a wise person, as they can guide you towards your destination; there's no need to measure their wisdom with human standards.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Santdāse shīkh māgī, chālyā vege vaḷī baḍabhāgī; <RHYME_19>
Āvyā Swāmī Sahajānand pāse, karyā darashan Santdāse.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The soul of the devotee is pulled towards God, just like a boat drifts away in the river current. The Supreme Lord, Sahajananda, grants them a glimpse of their true nature.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī karī Dalujīnī vāt, sāmbhaḷī Mahārāje sākṣhāt; <RHYME_20>
Dalujī te mukta avatār, ek bāī paṇ niradhār.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The divine wind blows from the north, witnessed by Lord Maharaaj himself. The Dalujee soul is liberated, unattached to worldly attachments like a bird in flight.

transliteration.couplet:
Divyamūrti e jāṇajyo doy, anya-janne bheṭya na hoy; <RHYME_21>
Tenā darshan karyā Santdāse, rahī potye ṣhaṭ mās pāse.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: A person's true form is revealed only to someone who loves them dearly; no one else gets to see it. One should have a darshan (vision) of their loved ones, but not with just anyone.

transliteration.couplet:
E to paracho kahyo me ek, evā bījā thayā chhe anek; <RHYME_22>
Pachhī rahyā tiyā kāī dan, vaḷatā em bolyā Bhagwan.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: One seed may be enough to give birth to many, and yet there's only one God;

transliteration.couplet:
Santdāsne kahyu sānamā, jāo tame Badarivanmā; <RHYME_23>
Naranārāyaṇ Ṛuṣhirāy, je rahyā chhe Badrivan māy.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Go to Badri Vanam, where the Lord's divine beauty abides; it is the eternal dwelling place of Narayan and his devotees.

transliteration.couplet:
Ekarūp amāru chhe eh, bīju prakaṭ dekho chho teh; <RHYME_24>
Bahurūpe bahudhāme rahu chhu, tyānā vāsīne sukh dau chhu.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one's true nature is revealed through their thoughts and actions, just as a tree's seeds manifest its characteristics. Despite having different forms or appearances, one can still find inner peace by acknowledging their true self.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ Badrikāshramnā vāsī, ati tyāg vairāgye tapasī; <RHYME_25>
Māṭe e chhe vahalā mane ati, tene joī āvo mahāmati.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: A person who lives in the Badri ashram and practices self-control through detachment and austerities is considered highly noble-minded; such a one is indeed revered by all.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī chālyā tyāthī Santdās, Narnārāyaṇ Ṛuṣhi pās; <RHYME_26>
E to vāt chhe āshcharyakārī, jojyo sahu antare vichārī.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the journey of a saint named Santdas, who has left his worldly concerns behind and is now engaged in deep contemplation of God. It highlights the importance of introspection and spiritual growth through self-reflection and quiet contemplation.

transliteration.couplet:
Ā dehe je jāvu Uttardesh, Himādri par karī pravesh; <RHYME_27>
Te to ā sharīre na javāy, jāy te to īshvar kahevāy.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The soul goes to the heavens above, merging with the Lord's abode on Himādri Mountain. There, it does not reside in another physical form, but rather aspires towards its divine reality.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī sāmarthi je thakī āve, te to sarvanu kāraṇ kāve; <RHYME_28>
Tenī āgnā laī Santdāse, chālyā Uttar Khanḍe hulāse.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The ability that is present within oneself can be the reason for achieving everything; taking the fire of passion to Lord Krishna and dancing in the court of Uttar Khanda.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati vasamā vikaṭ ghāṭ, tandhārīne nahi jāvā vāṭ; <RHYME_29>
Evī vāṭe chālyā vītarāgī, gayā Himāḷā pār subhāgī.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a person who is not only lovely but also free from worldly attachments and desires, like the snow-capped Himalayas that remain untouched by human activities.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī āvī tyā patharā nadī, tandhārī tare nahi kadi; <RHYME_30>
Dhātu kāṣhṭhādik vastu kāī, thāy pathar paḍe pāṇī māi.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a river that flows gently and doesn't allow anyone to cross; meanwhile, the foundation of life is unstable and easily washed away like stones in the water.

transliteration.couplet:
Eve guṇe jukta jāṇī nīr, pag na boḷyo besiyā tīr; <RHYME_31>
Karatā ambu ūtaravā vichār, eve same āvyā ṛuṣhi chyār.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context:
A person who knows the value of their virtues is like a boat that remains untouched by the waves; they can stay calm in turbulent times.

In moments of crisis, one should consider the consequences of their actions and not act impulsively, just as a farmer carefully plans his harvest.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe kiyā jāvu munijan, muni kahe jāvu Badrikāvan; <RHYME_32>
Kahe ṛuṣhi chālo am sāth, mīcho ākhyo ūtariye pāth.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The sage is asked to go to Badrika Van, but he refuses, saying "I'll go where my heart leads me". He chooses not to follow the path, but rather let his conscience guide him.

transliteration.couplet:
Mīchyā lochan na karī vār, āvyā dash jojan jaḷ pār; <RHYME_33>
Tiyā dīṭhu chhe āshram sāru, beṭhā ṛuṣhi jyā lākh hajāru.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: A person's intelligence is not measured by their age, but by the depth of their wisdom and experience. True maturity lies in one's thoughts and actions, not just years lived.

transliteration.couplet:
Shubh badri adri ek sār, tiyā gufā hajāre-hajār; <RHYME_34>
Madhye gufā dīṭhī ek gherī, te to Narnārāyaṇ kerī.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context:
In a sacred grove, there's one special tree; beneath it, countless caves of blissful joy are found.

This tree is situated in the middle, where Naranarayana (divine abode) is realized.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā pahotyā potye Santdās, ūṭhī āpe maḷyā Avināsh; <RHYME_35>
Bahu hete karyu sanamān, bhale āvyā kahe Bhagwān.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The couplet talks about the spiritual journey of Santdas, who has achieved eternal life and is praised by God. It also mentions that a person's true intentions are known to God, regardless of their external actions.

transliteration.couplet:
Āpyā ṛuṣhie amaḷ jaḷ, pachhī jamāḍyā sundar faḷ; <RHYME_36>
Tyār pachhī pūchhyu Ṛuṣhirāy, kaho Mahā-Prabhuno mahimāy.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The beauty of the world is like a lovely jewel, and its creator is the beautiful Lord Krishna; I ask you to tell me about His great glory.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe Narnārāyaṇ Nāth, shu kare chhe Hari ṛuṣhi sāth; <RHYME_37>
Kahe Santdās shu hu kahu, āj vāt alekhe chhe bahu.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: Lord Narayan is the one who does everything with Hari's guidance; even I, a saint, am doing something only because of many circumstances today.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāvare chhe sāmarthi je Shyām, kahetā man vāṇī pāme virām; <RHYME_38>
Te to jāṇo chho sarave Nāth, pūchhyu māṭe kahu joḍī hāth.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context:
With God's will, everyone has strength like Shyam; we just need to speak our mind and wait for a peaceful resolution.
We all know that God is the Lord of everyone, so let's ask Him what should be done with this hand that holds our fate.

transliteration.couplet:
Em pūchhatā shubh samāchār, kahyā Santdāse niradhār; <RHYME_39>
Em kahetā sāmbhaḷatā vaḷī, thaī sandhyā sundar niramaḷī.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The auspicious occasion is good to discuss with Santdāse without attachment; He will share the joyous and beautiful evening with me like a fragrant flower.

transliteration.couplet:
Beṭhā shubhāsane beu vīr, āvyā darshane muni sudhīr; <RHYME_40>
Nayaṇā bharīne nīrakhyā Nāth, pachhī maḷyā Santdās sāth.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: In a virtuous family, a true hero is found, and in the spiritual guide's presence, one becomes enlightened. The Lord, who is filled with mercy, accompanies the devotee, just like a friend.

transliteration.couplet:
Sahu bolāve het samet, haiye bhāv dekhāḍe chhe het; <RHYME_41>
Kahe Nārāyaṇ suṇo sant, ā to ṛuṣhi chhe tyāgī atyant.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The couplet conveys that true understanding (het) comes from listening to others' words and experiences (sahu bolāve), and one should look beyond appearances (bhāv dekhāḍe).

transliteration.couplet:
Koīkne vīte varṣh bār, tyāre ek din kare āhār; <RHYME_42>
Koīkne vīte ṣhaṭ varṣh, tyāre lāge chhe bhūkh ne tarṣh.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: When one is young and not yet tired of life, they enjoy every moment; but when one grows old and tired, even a single day's sustenance feels like a struggle.

transliteration.couplet:
Koīk jame varase ek, ṣhaṭ māsavāḷā chhe anek; <RHYME_43>
Koī kare chhe mahināmā āhār, pakṣhavāḷā hajāro-hajār.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: One person has a single piece of clothing, but many people have multiple worries; one person eats a meal, while countless others worry about their food.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarve jan samādhiye sukhī, koī rītye ṛuṣhi nathī dukhī; <RHYME_44>
Sarvenā chhe tap-may tan, antar vṛuttiye kare bhajan.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context:
When all souls are in harmony, no one suffers from worldly troubles; the self is pure and engaged in devotion.

The soul is fiery and passionate, but it is tamed by internal discipline.

transliteration.couplet:
Jyāre ichchhe anna jaḷ jeh, āpī jāy siddhi sadya teh; <RHYME_45>
Em vāt karī narvīre, suṇī Santdāsjī sudhīre.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: The person who has a strong desire for knowledge will attain success soon enough; the wind of inspiration blows upon one's head and fills it with wisdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā vītyā kāī din, karyu Mānasare jāvā man; <RHYME_46>
Tyāre santne kahe Narvīr, nhāsho nīre nahi khame sharīr.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: When good deeds are done on certain days, the mind is prepared for self-realization; Only he who has achieved spiritual peace can say that his ego and body are not harmed.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe vaṇ nāhye vahelā vaḷajyo, muni sahit joī mane maḷajyo; <RHYME_47>
Pachhī Mānasare gayā jan, dīṭhā hansa kamaḷnā van.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: In the forest of life, one should not get caught up in worldly desires, and instead focus on inner happiness with a peaceful mind. The heart should sing like a bird in freedom, without being trapped by materialistic attachments.

transliteration.couplet:
Joī pāchhā vaḷyā ṛuṣhirāy, nāhyā Santdāsjī te māy; <RHYME_48>
Vyāpī shīt ne ṭharyu sharīr, lāvyā upāḍī jyā Narvīr.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: When the body is worn out and tired, one should take rest; the soul's nourishment is not obtained through physical exhaustion.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī bahu tāpe tapāḍyu tan, tyāre sachet thayā munijan; <RHYME_49>
Pachhī lāgyā Nārāyaṇ pāy, rahyā mās pakṣha muni tyāy.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee's spiritual growth as they strive to overcome worldly attachments and reach a state of inner peace and devotion. Ultimately, the devotee attains liberation through their devotion to Lord Narayana.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Narvīr kahe Santdās, tame jāo mahā Prabhu pās; <RHYME_50>
Je chhe te to sarave chhe tiyā, shāne besī raho sādhu iyā.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: Santdas says that when one has reached the peak of spirituality, they should go to God's abode; for then, all worries will cease and a sadhu (a saintly person) can peacefully dwell.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahī shīkh dīdhī Nāth, mokalyā ṛuṣhi chyārane sāth; <RHYME_51>
Te utārī gayā nadī pār, vaḷyā pāchhā karī namaskār.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a shepherd (shikh) who is accompanied by his flock to the other side of the river, where he bows down in respect and gratitude. The phrase "sāth" implies a sense of companionship and shared journey with God (Nāth).

transliteration.couplet:
Chālyā muni haiyāmā hulāse, āvyā sundar desh Kailāse; <RHYME_52>
Teno haṭhayogī rahe naresh, āvī āpyo tene upadesh.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: In the land of heavenly beauty, Kailasa, there are no worldly desires. The yogi should remain a king, and thusly give up spiritual guidance.

transliteration.couplet:
Rājā jāto samādhimā jyāre, raheto ṣhaṭamās sudhī tyāre; <RHYME_53>
Rāj sāj sut ne kalatra, tiyā sāmbhartutu nirantra.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: A king's meditation is interrupted by worldly worries, and a wise person's peace is disturbed by the chatter of foolish people. A husband is torn between his love for his wife and his attachment to worldly pleasures.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene Santdāse sukhī kīdho, anya bhāv ūgavā na dīdho; <RHYME_54>
Karāvyā prakaṭnā darshan, thaī sukhī rāye tajyu tan.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: One who has found the ultimate truth is at peace and not bothered by anything else; their happiness is self-evident and shines like a light.

transliteration.couplet:
Fūṭī tāḷu ne nīsaryā prāṇ, chālyo satsang karī sujāṇ; <RHYME_55>
Tyāthī Santdāsjī sadhāvyā, ek Veravāle gām āvyā.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: Santdasji went to a village called Veraval, having left his mortal life behind.

transliteration.couplet:
Zālyā taskar karīne teṇe, ati prahār karī bāndhyā eṇe; <RHYME_56>
Heru jāṇī diye dukha bahu, kare māravā manasūbo sahu.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context: When someone is eager to get into trouble, they will go to great lengths to do so. Many sorrows come from not understanding one's own mind.

transliteration.couplet:
Tenā sagā vālā jan jeh, āvyā Nāth rūp dharī teh; <RHYME_57>
Maḷī vaḷī mukāviyo jan, chālyā dāsne dai darashan.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The devotee's soul is united with the Lord, taking on His form and characteristics. The divine play begins, and the Lord grants a glimpse of Himself to those who are eager to behold Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī Santdāsjī sadhāvyā, ghaṇe dane Gujardhar āvyā; <RHYME_58>
Jetalpur Ḍabhāṇ gām, din dash karyo visharām.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: A saintly person's thoughts are pure and kind, just like the Gujarati language is melodious and sweet. In Jetalpur village, one should spend their days in leisure and relaxation.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī tyāthī āvyā Prabhu pās, maḷyā Nāth sante Santdās; <RHYME_59>
Sanamukh besī santjane, kahyu je je pūchhyu Bhagwane.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: A devotee finds peace by surrendering to the Lord's will, and seeks spiritual guidance from Him. In seeking answers, one should approach God with humility and an open heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Karī sundar vāratā sāne, samajī suṇī nahi keṇe kāne; <RHYME_60>
Kahyu alaukik je ākhyān, samaje sant kahe Shrī Bhagwān.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: The beauty of the divine is not understood by those who are deaf to its call and busy with worldly matters. The sublime stories of God's glory are shared by the saints who speak of Sri Bhagwan.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Nāth kahe dhanya dhanya, tam jevo bījo nahi jan; <RHYME_61>
Tame pāmyā chho siddhagati, māṭe sahuthī moṭā tame ati.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context:
The couplet praises God for being merciful and granting salvation to those who seek it, despite their imperfections not being understood by others.

In this state of spiritual growth, one's heart is filled with joy and love, surpassing worldly attachments.

transliteration.couplet:
Have faro satasang māi, karo vāt tame dīṭhī tyāī; <RHYME_62>
Evā samarth sant vikhyāt, pāmyā jethī tenī sai vāt.  <RHYME_62>
transliteration.context: A wise person is one who is mindful of their own company and knows when to remain silent, just like a tree that stands tall without seeking attention. Such a saintly individual is renowned for their self-control and humility.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāt moṭī chhe Mahārāj taṇī, kahī na jāy mukhthī ghaṇī; <RHYME_63>
Hari harijanno mahimāy, kahe jathārath na kevāy.  <RHYME_63>
transliteration.context: The breath of the king is strong and free, his wisdom cannot be measured; He speaks words of God's glory, with no hesitation or delay.
